channel.title: Songs you would play to a loved one?
channel.description:
Hey guys. I've always wondered this, I don't really know how many of you are musicians or anything like that but I just wanted to know what would be your one song that you would play if you had 5 minutes left with your girlfriend/fiancee/wife or other way about, boyfriend/fiancee/husband.
Before me and my girlfriend split up I played her this before it became mainstream and what not. I don't generally like one direction and neither did she but that song is 100% her, it was quite weird how similar it was actually. The song was also more or less perfect for my voice so that was good. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xGPeNN9S0Fg
but yeah, post yours and your stories!

item.title: Songs you would play to a loved one?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:11, topic:469974”][quote author=Krackkid link=topic=587299.msg4167891#msg4167891 date=1353898896]

of course
[/quote]I love that song so much.

[quote author=Ruby link=topic=587299.msg4167886#msg4167886 date=1353898415]

Michael Jackson - The Way You Make Me Feel.

Excellent choice, mate.

I actually wrote a song for my ex-girlfriend that ended with me asking her out. Though, it backfired because she thought I really liked her when really I just wrote lovey dubey lyrics because they’re easy. Hehehe…

I’ve done that a few times as well, Lin! I think I have a total of about 18 songs written or something, not one of them is complete without me singing about a girl haha. I find it hard to write about anything besides love, actually. Especially since all you need to do is finger pick through 4 chords to make it sound soft and love-like if you’re playing along to it with a guitar. I’m glad someone else here done something like this, do you find it easy to write a lot of songs or do you need a certain inspiration to write about?
[/quote]I’ve actually written over 15 complete rock songs with two guitars, a bass, drums, and sometimes additional instruments and over 100 pieces of music containing usually all four, not counting the ones my friend and I have written for our band. Usually for lyrics it’s just writing what sounds good. No inspiration needed in my opinion.[/quote]
Wow, that’s impressive! I used to be into a lot of rock/punk songs and writing them but I’ve kind of outgrown it by now, I’m more into acoustic and blues. I use my acoustic for the soft, sappy love songs and then the blues to get the rest of my talent across more or less. It sounds nice that you can write for each instrument, not just the guitar/voice. I wish lyrics came to me like that, they just come in a spur of the moment type thing. If I get a strong wave of emotion somewhere whether it be due to nostalgia, deja vu whatever, I get a song coming to my head and I just write it down somewhere. It’s hard to explain :o

Read full topic

[/quote]
Excellent choice, mate.

I actually wrote a song for my ex-girlfriend that ended with me asking her out. Though, it backfired because she thought I really liked her when really I just wrote lovey dubey lyrics because they’re easy. Hehehe…

I’ve done that a few times as well, Lin! I think I have a total of about 18 songs written or something, not one of them is complete without me singing about a girl haha. I find it hard to write about anything besides love, actually. Especially since all you need to do is finger pick through 4 chords to make it sound soft and love-like if you’re playing along to it with a guitar. I’m glad someone else here done something like this, do you find it easy to write a lot of songs or do you need a certain inspiration to write about?[/quote]I’ve actually written over 15 complete rock songs with two guitars, a bass, drums, and sometimes additional instruments and over 100 pieces of music containing usually all four, not counting the ones my friend and I have written for our band. Usually for lyrics it’s just writing what sounds good. No inspiration needed in my opinion.
